item.title: Andrew Shitov Weekly Review: Challenge - 263
item.description: Raku Solutions Weekly Review Task 1 In the first task, you have an array of integers @ints and a target number $k. You need to print the indices of those elements, which are equal to the target, but you need to search in the sorted source data. Thoughts What does Raku offer that can be used in this task? First, the sort routine, which you can use as a method or as a stand-alone function:

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 264
item.description: TABLE OF CONTENTS 01. HEADLINES 02. SPONSOR 03. RECAP 04. PERL REVIEW 05. RAKU REVIEW 06. CHART 07. NEW MEMBERS 08. GUESTS 09. TASK #1: Greatest English Letter 10. TASK #2: Target Array HEADLINES Welcome to the Week #264 of The Weekly Challenge. Thank you, Andrew Shitov, for reviewing Raku solutions for the Week #262. There was a time when we used to have weekly reviews of both Perl and Raku solutions.

item.title: Andrew Shitov Weekly Review: Challenge - 262
item.description: Raku Solutions Weekly Review Task 1 The first task was to find and display the number of either positive or negative integers, whatever is larger. Let us start from the easy part. In Raku, there is a a built-in max function (or method if you want to use an object notation: @array.max). So, the code is: say max($neg, $pos); where $neg and $pos are the numbers of negative and positive data items in the original array.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - Guest Contributions
item.description: As you know, The Weekly Challenge, primarily focus on Perl and Raku. During the Week #018, we received solutions to The Weekly Challenge - 018 by Orestis Zekai in Python. It was pleasant surprise to receive solutions in something other than Perl and Raku. Ever since regular team members also started contributing in other languages like Ada, APL, Awk, BASIC, Bash, Bc, Befunge-93, Bourne Shell, BQN, Brainfuck, C3, C, CESIL, Chef, COBOL, Coconut, C Shell, C++, Clojure, Crystal, D, Dart, Dc, Elixir, Elm, Emacs Lisp, Erlang, Excel VBA, F#, Factor, Fennel, Fish, Forth, Fortran, Gembase, GNAT, Go, GP, Haskell, Haxe, HTML, Hy, Idris, IO, J, Janet, Java, JavaScript, Julia, Korn Shell, Kotlin, Lisp, Logo, Lua, M4, Maxima, Miranda, Modula 3, MMIX, Mumps, Myrddin, Nelua, Nim, Nix, Node.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 263
item.description: TABLE OF CONTENTS 01. HEADLINES 02. SPONSOR 03. RECAP 04. PERL REVIEW 05. RAKU REVIEW 06. CHART 07. NEW MEMBERS 08. GUESTS 09. TASK #1: Target Index 10. TASK #2: Merge Items HEADLINES Welcome to the Week #263 of The Weekly Challenge. Let us all welcome, Reinier Maliepaard from Netherlands to Team PWC. He shared solutions to the Week 260 and Week 262. We have interviewed champion Nelo Tovar finally.

item.title: Meet The Champion: January 2024
item.description: Get to know about Nelo Tovar Welcome to the monthly series Meet The Champion. Last month we declared Kjetil Skotheim, the winner of December 2023. Today we are talking to Nelo Tovar, the winner of January 2024 of The Weekly Challenge. I hope you are going to enjoy the interview. Mohammad: Tell us about your technical background? Nelo: I graduated as a Computer Engineer from UCLA (Barquisimeto - Venezuela) in Nov/1992.

TASK #2: Count Equal Divisible HEADLINES Welcome to the Week #262 of The Weekly Challenge. As we all know, we regularly receive solutions in guest languages. Python is the leading language in the list. Last week, two more languages added to the list, thanks to Ali Moradi and Lance Wicks.
